name: Air Fryer Salmon with Maple-Bourbon Glaze
author: thedailygourmet
summary: This salmon starts from frozen and is dressed up with an easy maple-bourbon glaze. A hint of Sriracha also gives a pop of spice to counteract the sweetness of the maple syrup.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 teaspoon Sriracha sauce, or more to taste
directions: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 minutes
Sprinkle salmon fillets with salt and pepper and place into the air fryer basket
Air-fry for 6 minutes, or 8 minutes if the fillets are thick
Meanwhile, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Stir in bourbon, maple syrup, Sriracha, and salt
Continue stirring while glaze comes to boil
As soon as it boils, immediately lower heat to medium-low, and cook until glaze has thickened, about 10 minutes
Brush glaze onto salmon fillets using a silicon brush
Lower air fryer temperature to 370 degrees F (187 degrees C) and air-fry for an additional 6 minutes, or 8 minutes if the fillets are thick
